comments:
Build ID: I20070503-1400
CDT build 4.0.0.200705021527

I can't provide detailed steps to reproduce the bug, but I have included the log for the entire session, as well as a screen shot.

The C++ project was created in CDT 3.1/Eclipse 3.2.2, and I had just opened it in read-only mode in 4.0RC1/3.3M7.

There was one tab in the editor view, with the title "counting.cpp", but the text in the display was from "counting.h".

I clicked the close button for the tab, and the tab disappeared, but the text remained.

The text is editable, and remains if the editor view is minimized and restored.

More information:

java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -startup C:\Program Files\Java\eclipse3.3M7\plugins\org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070502.jar

Created an attachment (id=66783)
Screenshot of editor corruption

Seems like Mylar is interfering here. While an editor is opened, Mylar tries to close the editor again:
!MESSAGE Warning: Blocked recursive attempt by part
org.eclipse.cdt.ui.editor.CEditor to dispose itself during creation
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.ui.PartInitException: Warning: Blocked recursive attempt by part
org.eclipse.cdt.ui.editor.CEditor to dispose itself during creation\
[...]
org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.closeEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:1366)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.resources.ui.EditorInteractionMonitor.editorOpened(EditorInteractionMonitor.java:68)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.monitor.ui.workbench.AbstractEditorTracker.partOpened(AbstractEditorTracker.java:32)
[...]

I suggest to install the newest development version of Mylar. If the problem persists, please raise a bug against Mylar.
